Title: Landslides
Description: Students will: understand the causes and effects of landslides, explore ways to prevent and protect against landslides.

Title: Fossils
Description: Students will: understand the nature of a fossil and how fossils are formed, understand what fossils can teach us about organism development and Earth’s history, examine a variety of fossils, create strategies for identifying a fossil’s organism.

Title: Earth's History through Rocks, Fossils and Tree Rings
Description: Students will learn how fossils, rocks, and tree rings help us to understand—and help provide a timeline for— Earth’s history.

Title: Weather and climate
Description: Students will: differentiate between weather and climate, identify the five major types of climate in the world, understand how elevation, latitude, ocean currents, wind, and topography help determine a region’s climate.

Title: Moon Phases
Description: Students will identify the various moon phases and the time periods in which they occur. They will also understand the relationship between tides the moon phases.

Title: Solar System
Description: Students will understand Earth's revolution and tilt and how these relate to seasons.

Title: Transferring Energy
Description: Students will explore ways in which energy can be transformed from one form to another.

Title: Changes of Matter
Description: Students will: understand that some changes of matter are reversible while others are not, understand how water can change from a solid to a liquid to a gas and back, understand some common chemical reactions.

Title: Properties of Light
Description: Students will: understand that light has a source, travels in a direction, can be blocked to make shadows, and reflect off mirrors and other surfaces, objects are seen when light travels from an object into the eye.

Title: Extinct and Endangered Animals
Description: Students will: understand extinction and how species become extinct or endangered, identify some endangered species and understand the reasons why these species are endangered.

Title: Reduce, Reuse, and Recycle
Description: Students will: explore and understand why it is important to reduce, reuse and recycle materials, explore the effects of pollution on Earth and living organisms, identify ways to reduce, reuse and recycle materials in their everyday lives.

Title: Forces
Description: Learn the different ways that objects can move. Understand that motion is the result of a force, understand that a force is a push or a pull, examine how the size of a force and the mass of an object effects motion.

Title: Changing Motion
Description: Students will: understand that motion is the change in the position of an object which is caused by a force (a push or a pull), recognize speed as a measure of motion and be introduced to friction as a force which causes an object to slow down and stop.

Title: Seasonal Behavior
Description: Students will understand how and why plants and animals modify their behavior according to the season.

Title: Living vs. Non-Living
Description: Students will: compare living objects to non-living objects, describe the characteristics of each group, learn how to classify objects into either group.

Title: Introduction to Classification
Description: Students will explore the idea of grouping objects, plants, and animals by their common characteristics.

Title: All About Air
Description: Students will understand the characteristics and importance of air to living and non-living things.

Title: Inherited Traits vs Acquired Characteristics
Description: Students will: understand the meaning of traits, differentiate between inherited traits and acquired characteristics.

Title: How Plants Make Food
Description: Students will understand that plants make food from air, water, sunlight and nutrients from the soil (photosynthesis).

Title: Traits and Offspring
Description: Students will: distinguish between a trait and a behavior, describe the similarities and differences in the appearance and behaviors of some parents and their offspring.

Title: Food Chains
Description: Students will: identify the flow of energy in a food chain, distinguish between a food chain and a food web, understand the role of organisms with in a food chain/web, understand the importance of maintaining balance within a food chain/web.

Title: Sounds
Description: Students will: explore sounds, understand what causes sounds.

Title: Predator and Prey
Description: Students will: define predator and prey, match animals to their roles as either predator or prey (or both), understand the importance of having predators and prey in balance within an ecosystem.

Title: Day and Night
Description: Students will: Understand that the spinning of Earth around an imaginary axis (rotation) results in day and night. Compare shadows at various time of the day. Analyze models displaying sunlight on Earth in a 24-hour period.

Title: Patterns in the Night Sky
Description: Learn that stars form unchanging patterns in the sky, understand that some groups of stars form distinct patterns (constellations), understand that Earth’s rotation causes changes in the perceived position of constellations in the night sky.

Title: Physical Characteristics of Animals
Description: Students will: describe similarities and differences in the physical characteristics of animals, classify animals based on these characteristics.

Title: The Sun
Description: Students will describe the Sun, its properties, and its importance to Earth.

Title: Weather
Description: Students will: understand how air temperature, wind, and precipitation determine weather, what causes cloud formation and precipitation, recognize how humans and animals adapt to changes in weather that occur as a result of seasonal changes.

Title: Animal Adaptations Teeth and Diet
Description: Students will: learn about the three main types of teeth (incisors, canines and molars), understand the specific job function of each type of tooth, compare a variety of animal teeth, predict an animal’s diet based on their teeth.
